description:
As a Manager in YouTube’s Product Partnerships team, you will help drive growth through partnerships with Consumer Electronics device manufacturers spanning Smart TVs and streaming platforms. You will contribute excellent partner management skills, strategic thinking, deep knowledge of OTT video app distribution, experience with complexities and opportunities of such distribution on Smart TVs, good knowledge of video technologies such as DRM, Video codecs (including working with SoC vendors), device ecosystem in the Living Room, and a passion for media and entertainment.

In this role, you will lead device partnerships across all of YouTube apps (e.g., YouTube, YouTube TV, YouTube Kids) driving both ubiquity and engagement while creating the best user experience. You will provide strategic leadership, partnership vision, executing complex agreements, advocating forward-looking video technologies, and working closely with YouTube Product, Engineering, Marketing, and other cross-functional teams. You will ensure YouTube's success through TV OEM partnerships, shaping the future of user discovery, engagement, and experiences on YouTube.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 10 year of professional work experience.
  • 9 years of experience in business development, OTT app distribution, the streaming video industry, and CE device partnerships.
  • Experience managing agreements with device manufacturers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Experience deploying and/or distributing OTT video app(s) on Smart TVs. Experience in Consumer Electronics devices distribution, marketing, and economics from an OEM perspective.
  • Experience in managing and growing executive relationships, collaborating and influencing cross-functionally with technical and business teams.
  • Track record of excellent execution and demonstrated global scope. Ability to work with legal agreements and rive growth through strategic thinking and partnerships.
  • Understanding of smart TVs, streaming platforms, and the hardware industry as it relates to video streaming technologies.
  • Passion for digital media and entertainment.
responsibilities:
• Drive YouTube’s device partnership strategy with CE device manufacturers.
  • Manage and execute term sheets/agreements with partners, driving subscriptions, app distribution, and marketing commitments.
  • Build detailed account plans by OEMs, organize and execute QBRs with top partners, and drive YouTube presence at key industry conferences.
  • Work with leaders and cross-functional teams in bridging internal and external priorities, roadmaps, and perspectives.
  • Develop performance key performance indicators (KPIs) and data driven approaches to measure impact and success.
title: Manager, Device Partnerships, Consumer Electronics, YouTube
